meanings.sent1: The huffiest peacock strutted around the farm, thinking it was better than all the other birds.
meanings.sent2: She always acted like the huffiest person in the room, never willing to listen to anyone else's ideas.
meanings.sent3: The huffiest cat in the neighborhood refused to play with the other felines, believing itself to be royalty.
meanings.sent4: His huffiest attitude made him blind to the kindness of others, isolating him in his own self-importance.
meanings.sent5: The huffiest rooster in the coop would never share the spotlight with any other bird, crowing loudly to assert dominance.

meanings.definition: In a state of being puffed up or swollen
meanings.sent1: The huffiest balloon at the party was about to burst from being filled with too much air.
meanings.sent2: The pastry looked huffiest after being left in the oven for too long, expanding beyond its intended size.
meanings.sent3: The huffiest tire on the car needed to be deflated slightly to prevent it from popping on the bumpy road.
meanings.sent4: The huffiest cheeks on the child were a result of blowing up too many balloons at the birthday party.
meanings.sent5: The huffiest pillow in the room was so overfilled that it was uncomfortable to rest your head on.
